sentence.Network_en: The improved trade figures have given the government fresh ammunition.
sentence.Network_cn: 有所改观的贸易数据给政府提供了新的有力证据。

sentence.Network_en: Most of the ships were woefully short of ammunition.
sentence.Network_cn: 大多数舰船弹药极度匮乏。

sentence.Network_en: Government forces are running short of ammunition and fuel.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府军队的弹药和燃料都所剩无几了。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from obsolete French amunition, alteration (by wrong division) of la munition 'the munition' (see munition)

entry.def: Ammunition is bullets and rockets that are made to be fired from guns.

example.ex: He had only seven rounds of ammunition for the revolver.
example.tran: 他这把左轮手枪只有7梭子子弹。

entry.tran: （辩论或讨论中可攻击对方的）信息，事实，炮弹
entry.def: You can describe information that you can use against someone in an argument or discussion as ammunition.

example.ex: The improved trade figures have given the government fresh ammunition.
example.tran: 有所改观的贸易数据给政府提供了新的有力证据。

means.word_mean: 1. projectiles to be fired from a gun
2. any nuclear or chemical or biological material that can be used as a weapon of mass destruction
3. information that can be used to attack or defend a claim or argument or viewpoint;

sentences.sentence: "his admission provided ammunition for his critics"

auth_sentence.content: Rabbani wasn't sending money or ammunition to me.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Rabbani wasn't sending money or ammunition to me.

auth_sentence.content: No, this wasn't loaded with conventional ammunition.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: No, this wasn't loaded with conventional ammunition.

auth_sentence.content: They were allowed to use live ammunition if called for.
auth_sentence.res_content: They were allowed to use live ammunition if called for.

sentences.en: When the soldiers had used up all their ammunition, they went on fighting with their swords.
sentences.cn: 当战士们弹药用完时, 他们继续用刺刀作战。

jushi.english: This letter gave her all the ammunition she needed.
jushi.chinese: 这封信给她提供了她所需要的一切论据。
